info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 5:57PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN KENTON, CAMPBELL, SOUTHEASTERN HAMILTON AND WESTERN CLERMONT COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM EDT... At 556 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Forestville, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Covington, Independence, Norwood, Fort Thomas, Newport, Blue Ash, Loveland, Reading, Montgomery, Madeira, Edgewood, Alexandria, Fort Mitchell, Villa Hills, Highland Heights, Milford, Taylor Mill, Bellevue and Deer Park. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 15. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 188 and 191. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 4, and between mile markers 6 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
